G4536-d-04-07-99-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
G4536-d-04-07-99-WC.Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
G4536-d-04-07-99-WC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES, THE 0630 EW SWITCH CREW HAD PUT 11 LOADS INTO TRACK 266.  THEY THEN PICKED UP 7 LOADS & 29 EMPTIES AND TOOK THEM TO TRACK 266, MADE A JOINT ON THE LOADS AND PROCEEDED TO SHOVE   ALL 47 CARS INTO THE TRACK.  WHILE SHOVING, A CARMAN NOTICED THE DERAILED CARS & CALLEDTO STOP THE MOVEMENT.  THE CAR HAD DERAILED AT THE FROG TO TRACK 266 & CLIMBED OVER THE GUARD RAILAT THAT POINT.  CAR DAMAGE WAS MINIMAL, BUT THE TRACK SUSTAINED QUITE A BIT OF DAMAGE. INVESTIGATIONINTO THE INCIDENT FOUND NO HUMAN, TRACK OR CAR FAILURES.  IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE LATERAL/VERTICAL FORCES CREATED WHEN THE CREW STARTED TO SHOVE THIS TRACK CAUSED THE CAR TO "WALK OFF" THE RAIL.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4533-d-04-21-99-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure hand brake on car(s) (railroad  employee)
G4533-d-04-21-99-WC.Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure hand brake on car(s) (railroad  employee)
G4533-d-04-21-99-WC.Narrative: THE 0620 EW SWITCH HAD GONE INTO TRACK 70 FROM THE EAST END AND PULLED 21 CARS DOWN TO BEGIN MAKINGUP TRAIN FDLGA. THEY CUT OFF 8 CARS ON THE LEAD AND BEGAN SWITCHING OUT THE REMAINING 13 CARS.  THEY PUT 4 CARS BACK AGAINST THE 8 CARS LEFT STANDING ON THE LEAD.  WHEN THEY DID THIS THEY HEARD, BUTDID NOT SEE, THE IMPACT OF THE CARS HITTING THE 12 CARS THAT WERE ON THE LEAD.  THE CONDUCTOR WALKEDUP TO SEE IF ANY CARS WERE DERAILED AND NONE WERE.  FURTHER INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE 0630 EW SWITCH HAD PULLED TRACK 70 AND IT WAS CLEAR.  THEY NOTICED THE 0730 WW SWITCH OF THIS.  THE CONDUCTOR ON THE 0730 WW SWITCH WAS LINING SWITCHES AND HAD ANOTHER CONDUCTOR LET CARS GO INTHE TRACK.  THE CARS DID NOT HAVE HAND BRAKES PROPERLY SECURED WHICH ALLOWED THE CAR TO ROLL BACK INTO THE CARS KICKED IN BY THE 0630 EW SWITCH.  NO CARS DERAILED , NOR WAS THERE ANY TRACK DAMAGE.  THE CONDUCTOR WAS TAKEN IN FOR TESTING AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVENoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4534-d-04-26-99-WC.Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
G4534-d-04-26-99-WC.Narrative: INVESTIGATION INTO THIS INCIDENT FOUND THAT WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES THE 1530 WW YARD JOB HAD PUT A CAR INTO TRACK 75 INSTEAD OF TRACK 73, AS INSTRUCTED.  NO ONE WAS AWARE THAT THE CAR WAS INTHE WRONG TRACK, ALL OF THE PAPERWORK AND YARDMASTERS SHOWED THE CAR IN TRACK 73 AS PLANNED.  THE CREW WAS INFORMED, BY THE YARDMASTER, TO PUT PLCX INTO TRACK 73, WHICH WAS SUPPOSED TO HAVE ONE CAR IN IT BUT IN FACT WAS CLEAR.  THE CREW KICKED PLCX 19248 INTO TRACK 73 WITH NO HANDBRAKE APPLIED ANDNO CAR IN TRACK 73 TO STOP ITS MOVEMENT.  THE CAR WENT OUT THE EAST END OF TRACK 73 (WHICH WAS LINEDFOR THEIR MOVEMENT) THROUGH THE TRACK 72 SWITCH (NOT LINED FOR THEIR MOVEMENT) AND INTO THE SIDE OFA STANDING CUT OF 37 CARS THAT WERE LEFT OUT TO FOUL ON TRACK71.  PLCX 19248 IMPACTED WITH AN EMPTYFLAT AND AN WMPTY HOPPER CAUSING ALL THREE CARS TO DERAIL.  PLCX 19248 ENDED UP ON ITS SIDE.  NEITHER OF THE CONDUCTOR ON THE 1530 WW JOB IN THE CAR KICKED HAD ANY INTENTION OF APPLYING A HANDBRAKESAS PER INSTRUCTIONS ISSUED AT FOND DU LAC.  HAD THE HANDBRAKE BEEN PROPERLY SET ON THE CAR, IT WOULDNOT HAVE ROLLED OUT THE TRACK AND INTO THE CAR ON TRACK 71. BOTH OF THESE CONDUCTOR WERE TAKEN IN FOR TESTING AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNone

WHILE COMING TO A STOP 561'SCREW OBSERVED APPROXIMATELY 50 CARS DEEP WHAT APPEARED TO BE CARS DERAILED AND ON SIDE IN THE DITCH.FURTHER INSPECTION REVEALED DERAILMENT OF 12 CARS, 6 ON SIDE AND IN DITCH AND 6 DERAILED UPRIGHT ON TRACK.  ALL CARS WERE EMPTIES, 11 GRAIN AND 1 COAL EMPTY.  WHILE INSPECTING TRACK FOR ADDITIONAL DAMAGE ORIGINAL POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS DETERMINED TO BE ABOUT 169.1. WHEEL SET FROM MDKX 6375 WAS FOUND WITH EXTREME BUILD UP AND IN ONE AREA FLANGE WORN EVEN WITH WHEEL. MDKX 6375 WAS FOUND IN DERAILMENT WITH HANDBRAKE STILL APPLIED.  IN CREW INTERVIEW CONDUCTOR CONVEYED HE WAS INSTRUCTED TO GET ONTRAIN AND UTILITY PERSON AT BENSENVILLE OBSERVED 561 FOR ANY HANDBRAKES AND/OR TRAIN CONSIST DISCREPANCIES.  EXTRA CAR IN HEAD END OF TRAIN 561 WAS FOUND THAT CONDUCTOR HAD NOT BEEN NOTIFIED OF.  DETERMINATION MADE BY MECHANICAL SERVICES TO DISMANTLE 6 CARS IN DITCH BECAUSE OF LOW VALUE.  HULCHE
